com.itko.lisa.stats

Class MetricCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.stats.MetricCollector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class MetricCollector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Base class for all metric collector objects. Users of this class will construct a subclass of this class directly then offer that object instance to the MetricController and other classes that want to use its services. These collectors must be instantiated with class-specific data, so there's no way around the knowledge of the subclass names.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VALUE_COUNTER

        public static final int VALUE_COUNTER
        Values coming from the collector in the getCurrentValue() method are of type Number (which can be any of Integer, Float, Double, etc.), and they are constantly increasing. They are reset whenever the system being queried is reset. For example, the number of errors on a device is a counter that is incremented every time it happens.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VALUE_GAUGE

        public static final int VALUE_GAUGE
        Values coming from the collector are a GAUGE, meaning that they are a current reading at a certain time. For example, CPU utilization is always a GAUGE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VALUETYPE_STRINGS

        public static final java.lang.String[] VALUETYPE_STRINGS
        Needed when we want to do something fun with the value type, like make a combo

      • isInitialized

      • initialize

        public final void initialize()

      • getMetricInitializationTimeout

        protected long getMetricInitializationTimeout()

      • subInitializeCollector

        protected boolean subInitializeCollector()
        This method should be overridden in any metric Collector. Any (long running) work needed to setup this collector should be done in this function. We will timeout if metric initialization takes more than some specified set of time (90000ms). Set lisa.metric.initialization.timeout property to override timeout length
        Returns:
        true if initialization completed successfully (metric collection will not happen if this returns false)

      • setCoordinator

        public void setCoordinator(Coordinator c)
        This method is generally called by the TestManager when setting up metrics to be used. So the MC gets told what the coordinator is.
        Parameters:
        c - the Coordinator of the test we are collecting for

        public Coordinator getCoordinator()

        Returns:
        the Coordinator we are collecting for

      • getScale

        public double getScale()
        This is the multiplier you should apply to the values that this collector provides to normalize the values to between 0 and 100. This doesn't mean that we guarantee that tho'.
        Returns:
        double scale value

      • getCurrentValue

        public java.lang.Object getCurrentValue()
        Called to ask this collector to do it's job -- go get the current value for the metric we're tracking. This method will BLOCK until it gets the data it wants, so make sure the thread running is planning for that. *
        Returns:
        the value back; we have no idea what it is, so we'll have to check

      • isValueString

        public boolean isValueString()

      • isValueNumber

        public boolean isValueNumber()

      • getValueType

        public int getValueType()
        Well we give you an Object, so what now? Could be anything.. So we have constants defined to prevent the dubious type checking so your casts will not throw exceptions. VALUE_STRING will safely cast to a String VALUE_COUNTER is a constantly increasing value of a parameter, a "talley" VALUE_GAUGE is a current reading of a parameter, a "current status"
        Returns:
        either VALUE_STRING, VALUE_COUNTER, or VALUE_GAUGE

      • close

        public void close()

      • defaultOnGraph

        public boolean defaultOnGraph()
        Some callers to this class might want to know if we think this particular metric should be showing by default Subclasses should override this and return true if they think so
        Returns:
        true if we think this should be showing by default

      • defaultOnSummary

        public boolean defaultOnSummary()
        Some callers to this class might want to know if we think this particular metric should be showing in the summary by default Subclasses should override this and return true if they think so
        Returns:
        true if we think this should be showing by default

      • getPreferredColor

        public java.awt.Color getPreferredColor()
        Metrics collectors can support a feature that gives them the chance to tell the rest of the world what Color they would like to be rendered in. For example, error metrics might like Color.Red. Obviously, this must be unique across all metrics, so do it sparingly...
        Returns:
        Color that you prefer, or null if you have no hard preference

      • setPreferredColor

        public void setPreferredColor(java.awt.Color color)

      • getShortName

        public abstract java.lang.String getShortName()
        Made this a stort-ish String that will fit in a table column, like: "LISA: Instances"
        Returns:
        String of the short name for this metric we are collecting

      • getMetricHelpString

        public abstract java.lang.String getMetricHelpString()
        Called when we want a human-readable "one-liner" about the value you are tracking. If you don't know, just return something, anything..
        Returns:
        a String for display about the metric being tracked
